Returns: @B_android#graphics#Bitmap_E@
A Bitmap containing the recommendation image.
getContentImage().Description: Returns the Bitmap containing the recommendation image.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
A string containing a representation of the content price in the current locale and currency.
getPricingValue().Description: Gets the price value (when applicable) for the content. The value will be provided as a String containing the price in the appropriate currency for the current locale.

Returns: int
An integer representing the maximum progress value.
getProgressMax().Description: Returns the maximum value for the progress data of this recommendation.

Parameters: int: The maximum value for the progress of this content.
int: The progress amount for this content. Must be in the range (0 - max).
setProgress(int, int).Description: Sets the progress information for the content pointed to by this recommendation.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
A String containing the group ID tag for this recommendation.
getGroup().Description: Returns the String group ID tag for this recommendation.

Returns: int
An integer value representing the accent color for this recommendation.
getColor().Description: Returns the accent color value to be used in the UI when displaying this content recommendation to the user.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
A Content URI pointing to the recommendation background image.
getBackgroundImageUri().Description: Returns a Content URI that can be used to retrieve the background image for this recommendation.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
A predefined tag indicating the pricing type for the content (see the CONTENT_PRICING_* constants).
getPricingType().Description: Gets the pricing type for the content.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
The String Id tag for this recommendation.
getIdTag().Description: Returns the String Id tag which uniquely identifies this recommendation.

Returns: int
An integer representing the recommendation progress amount.
getProgressValue().Description: Returns the progress amount for this recommendation.

Returns: boolean
true if this object is the same as the obj argument; false otherwise.
Parameters: Object: the reference object with which to compare.
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The equals method implements an equivalence relation on non-null object references: It is x, x.equals(x) should return true. It is x and y, x.equals(y) should return true if and only if y.equals(x) returns true. It is x, y, and z, if x.equals(y) returns true and y.equals(z) returns true, then x.equals(z) should return true. It is x and y, multiple invocations of x.equals(y) consistently return true or consistently return false, provided no information used in equals comparisons on the objects is modified. For any non-null reference value x, x.equals(null) should return false. The equals method for class Object implements the most discriminating possible equivalence relation on objects; that is, for any non-null reference values x and y, this method returns true if and only if x and y refer to the same object (x == y has the value true). Note that it is generally necessary to override the hashCode method whenever this method is overridden, so as to maintain the general contract for the hashCode method, which states that equal objects must have equal hash codes.

Parameters: String: A String containing the sort key for this recommendation.
setSortKey(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the String sort key for this recommendation. The sort key must be a String representation of a float number between 0.0 and 1.0, and is used to indicate the relative importance (and sort order) of a single recommendation within its specified group. The recommendations will be ordered in decreasing order of importance within a given group.

Parameters: int: The status value for the content. (see the CONTENT_STATUS_* for the valid status values).
setStatus(int).Description: Sets the availability status value for the content. This status indicates whether the content is ready to be consumed on the device, or if the user must first purchase, rent, subscribe to, or download the content.

Returns: int
a hash code value for this object.
hashCode().Description: Returns a hash code value for the object. This method is supported for the benefit of hash tables such as those provided by @B_java#util#HashMap_E@. The general contract of hashCode is: Whenever it is invoked on the same object more than once during an execution of a Java application, the hashCode method must consistently return the same integer, provided no information used in equals comparisons on the object is modified. This integer need not remain consistent from one execution of an application to another execution of the same application. If two objects are equal according to the equals(Object) method, then calling the hashCode method on each of the two objects must produce the same integer result. It is not required that if two objects are unequal according to the @B_java#lang#Object#equals_E@ method, then calling the hashCode method on each of the two objects must produce distinct integer results. However, the programmer should be aware that producing distinct integer results for unequal objects may improve the performance of hash tables. As much as is reasonably practical, the hashCode method defined by class Object does return distinct integers for distinct objects. (This is typically implemented by converting the internal address of the object into an integer, but this implementation technique is not required by the Java™ programming language.)

Returns: int
The status value for the content, or -1 is a valid status has not been specified (see the CONTENT_STATUS_* constants for the valid status values).
getStatus().Description: Returns availability status value for the content. This status indicates whether the content is ready to be consumed on the device, or if the user must first purchase, rent, subscribe to, or download the content.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
returns a predefined tag indicating the maturity level rating for the content (see the CONTENT_MATURITY_* constants).
getMaturityRating().Description: Returns the maturity level rating for the content.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
A predefined type tag (see the CONTENT_TYPE_* constants) indicating the primary content type for the recommendation.
getPrimaryContentType().Description: Returns the primary content type tag for the recommendation, or null if no content types have been specified.

Returns: int
An integer id for the badge icon resource.
getBadgeImageResourceId().Description: Returns the resource id for the recommendation badging icon. The resource id represents the icon resource in the source application package.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
A String containing the sort key for this recommendation.
getSortKey().Description: Returns the String sort key for this recommendation.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
An array of predefined type tags (see the CONTENT_TYPE_* constants) that describe the recommended content.
getContentTypes().Description: Returns an array containing the content types tags that describe the content. The first tag entry is considered the primary type for the content, and is used for content ranking purposes.

Returns: boolean
true if the recommendation is marked for auto dismissal, or false otherwise.
isAutoDismiss().Description: Indicates whether this recommendation should be dismissed automatically. Auto-dismiss notifications are automatically removed from the Home Screen when the user clicks on them.

Returns: boolean
true if the recommendation contains valid progress data, false otherwise.
hasProgressInfo().Description: Indicates if this recommendation contains valid progress information.

Returns: long
The run length, in seconds, of the content associated with the notification.
getRunningTime().Description: Returns the running time for the content.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
A String containing the recommendation content title.
getTitle().Description: Returns the content title for this recommendation.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
A String containing the recommendation description text.
getText().Description: Returns the description text for this recommendation.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
A String containing the recommendation source name.
getSourceName().Description: Returns the source application name for this recommendation.

Returns: @B_android#app#Notification_E@
A @B_android#app#Notification_E@ containing the stored recommendation data.
Parameters: Context: A @B_android#content#Context_E@ that will be used to construct the @B_android#app#Notification_E@ object which will carry the recommendation data.
getNotificationObject(android.content.Co.Description: Returns a @B_android#app#Notification_E@ object which contains the content recommendation data encapsulated by this object, which can be used for posting the recommendation via the @B_android#app#NotificationManager_E@.

Parameters: boolean: A boolean indicating if the recommendation should be auto dismissed or not.
setAutoDismiss(boolean).Description: Sets the flag indicating if this recommendation should be dismissed automatically. Auto-dismiss notifications are automatically removed from the Home Screen when the user clicks on them.

Parameters: String: A String containing the group ID tag for this recommendation.
setGroup(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the String group ID tag for this recommendation. Recommendations in the same group are ranked by the Home Screen together, and the sort order within a group is respected. This can be useful if the application has different sources for recommendations, like "trending", "subscriptions", and "new music" categories for YouTube, where the user can be more interested in recommendations from one group than another.

Returns: @B_android#support#app#recommendation#ContentRecommendation#IntentData_E@
An IntentData object, containing the data for the Intent that gets issued when the recommendation is clicked on.
getContentIntent().Description: Returns the data for the Intent that will be issued when the user clicks on the recommendation.

Returns: @B_android#support#app#recommendation#ContentRecommendation#IntentData_E@
An IntentData object, containing the data for the Intent that gets issued when the recommendation is dismissed from the Home Screen.
getDismissIntent().Description: Returns the data for the Intent that will be issued when the recommendation gets dismissed from the Home Screen, due to an user action.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
An array of genre tags that describe the recommended content.
getGenres().Description: Returns an array containing the genres that describe the content. Genres are open ended String tags.

ClassDesc: The ContentRecommendation object encapsulates all application provided data for a single content recommendation item.
